meanings.definition: A white pigment, typically made of lead carbonate.
meanings.sent1: The artist used ceruse to create highlights in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The ceruse was mixed with other colors to achieve the perfect shade.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally spilled ceruse on her shirt, turning it white.
meanings.sent4: The ceruse on the canvas glowed like moonlight in the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The purity of the ceruse made the artwork stand out among the rest.

meanings.definition: To whiten or lighten with ceruse.
meanings.sent1: She decided to ceruse the old furniture to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: The antique dresser was cerused to match the modern decor.
meanings.sent3: He cerused his hair with flour for a costume party, looking like a ghost.
meanings.sent4: Her smile cerused her face with joy, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun cerused the clouds with golden hues during the sunset.

meanings.definition: A cosmetic used to whiten the skin.
meanings.sent1: She applied ceruse to her face for a traditional theater performance.
meanings.sent2: The ceruse gave her skin a porcelain-like appearance on stage.
meanings.sent3: He mistakenly used ceruse as toothpaste, resulting in a comical white smile.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks glowed with the application of ceruse, enhancing her beauty.
meanings.sent5: The ceruse transformed her complexion, making her look ethereal.
